title: Nifty: Exhaustion Prevails Amid Trade Deal Ordeal
text:
On analysis of the movements of Nifty50 and , in different time frames, I find that the prevailing exhaustion seems to reflect the growing quantum of uncertainty over tariff trade war; which makes the deal an ordeal till it is finally sealed. But if it is not resolved immediately, it may be disastrous for the global equity markets; and may finally result in global equity meltdown. No doubt that hopes are still alive since the U.S.- China currency agreement being floated as a symbol of progress in this week's trade talks between the world's two largest economies, but still it is still premature to say whether an announcement would be made on the issue this week. Optimism over the talks has improved after the first-day 's negotiations wrapped up.

No doubt that Indian equity markets are also showing some strength amid growing optimism at international level, but still exhaustion seems to prevail over the movements of and ; as the uncertainty may grow after the announcement of economic data, which is scheduled to be announced on Friday after the closure of today’s trading session. I find that the Nifty 50 may show some exhaustion before the weekly closing as the uncertainty may grow on the first trading session of the upcoming week, if we find some weakness at the domestic front along with prevailing developments at international level; as the trade deal is still an ordeal till it sees light of the day.

Finally, I conclude that the volatility looks continue to prevail over the global equity markets till the Sino-U.S. trade deal is finally sealed; but any deviation from the right path of a positive resolution may be disastrous for the global economy. No doubt that both the partners of trade deal know this reality very well and hopefully they will likely adopt some midway to resolve this year-long damaging competition. I find that all the global equity markets have a vigil eye over the developments on trade talks, and look ready to react over the final outcome.
